issue.title: gizmodo.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://gizmodo.com/spheres-wizard-of-oz-re-release-was-one-of-2025s-highest-grossing-films-for-one-big-reason-2000712070](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgizmodo.com%2Fspheres-wizard-of-oz-re-release-was-one-of-2025s-highest-grossing-films-for-one-big-reason-2000712070) ### Comment > Site detects AdGuard is active and disables scroll. Main culprit seems to be a `overflow: hidden !important;` that gets injected into the root `` node when AdGuard is active, might be related to the cookies consent banner, which doesn't seem to get blocked properly ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://gizmodo.com/spheres-wizard-of-oz-re-release-was-one-of-2025s-highest-grossing-films-for-one-big-reason-2000712070](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgizmodo.com%2Fspheres-wizard-of-oz-re-release-was-one-of-2025s-highest-grossing-films-for-one-big-reason-2000712070) ### Comment > Site detects AdGuard is active and disables scroll. Main culprit seems to be a `overflow: hidden !important;` that gets injected into the root `` node when AdGuard is active, might be related to the cookies consent banner, which doesn't seem to get blocked properly ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/bl0ucit7ssg04ooo4k0gc80kgg0g0owqocw9m3kgdc.png?nc=1)

issue.title: fansided.com

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

comment.body:
It should be blocked with the mentioned dns filter. If you still have it, try beta or nightly channels. However, make a backup before doing so.
In case you still have the problem, please file an issue [here](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForWindows/issues/).

comment.body:
I can reproduce on iOS and it looks like that in this case a rule with wildcard like `yts.*` does not work and it's necessary to add `yts.bz`.
Popups rather cannot be fixed with app for iOS free version, because it does not support required rules.

comment.body:
there's race condition(related to Adcash script) & vpn ad reproduced
```adb
yts.lt,yts.*##.container div[class]:not([id]) > div[class]:not([id]):has(> div.title ~ a[href][rel="noindex, nofollow"])
yts.lt,yts.*#@#.container div[class]:not([id]) > div[class]:not([id]):has(> div.title ~ p.blue ~ a[href][rel="noindex, nofollow"])
yts.bz#%#//scriptlet('remove-node-text', 'script', 'Adcash')
```

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://iceout.org/en/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ficeout.org%2Fen%2F) ### Comment > The issue is that when you access this website, it immediately hits you with a terms of service window that only has one option (accept all), and when you try to block the window the adguard pop up selector gets pushed into the background and the terms of service window demands to be accepted before you can even select to block it through adguard. > > Adguard should be "On-Top" of all windows when it has been initiated, not lower priority than some shitty websites terms of service window. ### Screenshots

### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://iceout.org/en/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ficeout.org%2Fen%2F) ### Comment > The issue is that when you access this website, it immediately hits you with a terms of service window that only has one option (accept all), and when you try to block the window the adguard pop up selector gets pushed into the background and the terms of service window demands to be accepted before you can even select to block it through adguard. > > Adguard should be "On-Top" of all windows when it has been initiated, not lower priority than some shitty websites terms of service window. ### Screenshots

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.centralillinoisproud.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.centralillinoisproud.com%2F) ### Comment > If I go to this site with AdGuard enable I have to go through the "Press and Hold" to prove you're a human process every time. With AdGuard disabled I don't have to do this. This only started recently, in the past 2 weeks. I want to be able to have AdGuard enabled to block ads on the site. This has also been happening lately with www.walmart.com. Thanks. ``` Username: @JackLGM ``` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Ok, I did both of these things today and in both cases I got the captcha page when I went to the site.  

 

I think I was wrong about the once/day thing I mentioned before.  When I was doing that I had forgotten to re-enable AdGuard on the site so it was behaving normally.  Today when I enabled it I got the captcha page each time.  

 

Thanks

 

From: Sergey ***@***.***> 
Sent: Tuesday, January 20, 2026 5:54 PM
To: AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters ***@***.***>
Cc: JackLGM ***@***.***>; Mention ***@***.***>
Subject: Re: [AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters] www.centralillinoisproud.com (Issue #221503)

 

  <https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/18536328?s=20&v=4> Sergey-Lyapin left a comment (AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters#221503) <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/221503#issuecomment-3775488237> 

@JackLGM <https://github.com/JackLGM> 
Could you disable AdGuard Tracking Protection filter (Settings > Ad Blocking) and check if this helps?

q4wy7rej.jpg (view on web) <https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/338acfa4-4086-4186-950d-7ec5b6c07385> 

If this does not help, disable the entire Tracking protection module (Settings > Tracking protection) and check again.

comment.body:
Strange, it's not expected with the rule. Could you leave only AdGuard Tracking Protection filter and check it?
If you still have it after doing so, add this rule to user rules.
```adblock
||google.com/log?$redirect=nooptext,badfilter
```

issue.title: Still not whitelisted for motorola trc.taboola.com
issue.body: ### Prerequisites - [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer; - [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed; - [x] This is not an ad/bug report. ### Problem description I am Harsh Srivastava, Senior Implementation Specialist at Taboola. Motorola devices have a built-in application called Live Lockscreen. This application displays Taboola content. When I enable your plugin on Motorola devices, Taboola content is not displayed correctly. So, Could you whitelist Taboola domain? *.[taboola.com](http://taboola.com/) *.[taboolanews.com](http://taboolanews.com/) This built in app is quite easy to use by swiping and very critical if contents are not displayed.Kindly review my requests. ### Proposed solution Whitelist *.[taboola.com](http://taboola.com/) *.[taboolanews.com](http://taboolanews.com/) ### Additional information AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS DNS setup: | Device or router settings DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Default server System version: | Android Browser: | Edge
